boardgame.name: The Prison of K'aas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Prison of K'aas is a 5th edition adventure for character levels 7th-8th. Set in the Sak'Rata Rainforest, adventurers will battle extreme temperatures, disease, and horrific monsters to find the fabled Dracix'kun treasure hoard.

For generations, adventurers and fortune seekers have spread tales of the Dracix’kun lizardfolk and their fabled treasure hoard. Many have ventured into the dreaded Sak’Rata Rainforest to see if the legends were true but a scant few have returned. Survivors speak of savage monsters, bizarre aberrations, and, most of all, the vicious Dracix’kun lizardfolk. Undeterred, more adventurers go in search of the legend dreaming of the fabulous wealth that awaits. However, while most legends are inflated stories sung by bards to entertain, some tales hide truths far greater than can be believed.

The Prison of K'aas features:

Warring tribes of humans and lizardfolk
The Sak'Rata Rainforest where extreme heat and disease challenge the fortitude of even the hardiest adventurer
A covetous green dragon that seeks to steal the Dracix'kun treasure hoard
An ancient evil ready to break free and sew destruction
Ten new monsters to challenge the mettle of your heroes

boardgame.name: The Evil Under Clorehaven
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Evil Under Clorehaven is a short 5E adventure for 3rd to 4th level characters.

Once a prosperous boomtown, Clorehaven is now nothing more than a small collection of buildings nestled in the rugged hills of the western frontier. Home to a small contingent of the Royal Frontier Guard, a darkness has long lingered over the hamlet. Disappearances of new guardsmen and travelers are blamed on orc raiding parties but the clues left behind point to something more sinister.

The Evil Under Clorehaven features:

A small community of well developed NPCs set in a frontier hamlet
A mystery with a horrifying reveal
5 new monsters including the insidious gloom creeper and the vile gloomkin goblins.
3 optional adventure hooks to extend the adventure!

boardgame.name: Complete Binder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The binder is a band new class which lets you redefine your playstyle each day by attuning to the spirits of dead gods and heroes. These spirits from the past, called vestiges, afford their own features and traits, and each has a backstory all their own, drawn from the margins of world mythology. Their revisionist stories shine a light on tragic tales from across time, and ground the binder's personalities in genuine myth. The Complete Binder further expands the class's options with a plethora of variant rules, brand new subclasses, and even more vestiges to experiment with. If you want to play a character that can truly slide into any role, the binder is the class for you!

boardgame.name: Kyvadlo
Pendulum
Wahadło
Маятник
boardgame.description:
In Pendulum, each player is a powerful, unique noble vying to succeed the Timeless King as the true ruler of Dünya. Players command their workers, execute stratagems, and expand the provinces in their domain in real time to gain resources and move up the four victory tracks: power, prestige, popularity, and legendary achievement.

Players must use actual time as a resource in managing their strategy to best their opponents, using time on different action types and balancing it with time spent planning and analyzing. The winner will be the player who manages and invests their time most effectively and who builds the best engine, not the player who acts the quickest.

Pendulum is the highest-rated protoype in the history of the Stonemaier Games Design Day.

—description from the publisher

Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 5 Spieldauer: 1 Stunde Altersempfehlung: 12+
PENDULUM Pendulum ist ein zugloses Echtzeitstrategiespiel für 1-5 Spieler. Drei Sanduhren mit unterschiedlicher Laufzeit steuern den Fluss der Aktionen. Die Spieler müssen die echte Zeit für ihre Strategie im Auge behalten, um die Mitspieler zu schlagen. Es gilt, die Zeit bei verschiedenen Aktionsarten gut zu nutzen und die richtige Balance zwischen Planung, Analyse und Ausführung zu finden. Schneller ist nicht immer besser! Es gewinnt, wer seine Zeit am effektivsten plant und einsetzt. In Pendulum seid ihr mächtige Adelige und versucht die Nachfolge des Zeitlosen König als wahrer Herrscher von Dünya anzutreten. Jeder Anführer im Spiel ist einzigartig. Ihr kommandiert eure Arbeiter, setzt Kriegslisten ein und erobert weitere Provinzen. Dies alles geschieht in Echtzeit, um Rohstoffe und Stimmen zu erhalten und auf den vier Siegpunktleisten: Stärke, Ansehen, Beliebtheit und Legendäre Errungenschaft voranzuschreiten. Nutzt eure Zeit weise, da nur derjenige, der sich als am geeignetsten erweist, während der letzten Ratsversammlung als neuer Zeitloser Herrscher erklärt wird!
Inhalt: 5 doppelseitige Spielertableaus 1 Ratstableau 1 Spielanleitung 1 Spielbrett 1 Stanzbogen 1 Zeitanzeigetableau
Karten: 56 Provinzen (63 x 63 mm) 40 Kriegslisten (44 x 67 mm) 25 Ratsbelohnungen (44 x 67 mm) 10 Errungenschaften (59 x 91 mm) 5 Aktionsübersichten (59 x 91 mm) 5 finale Ratsbelohnungen (44 x 67 mm) 5 Übersichten für fortgeschrittene Anführer (59 x 91 mm) 1 Ratsbelohnung großer Arbeiter (44 x 67 mm)
Kunststoffmarker: 150 Rohstoffwürfel 50 Stimmenmarker 20 Siegpunktmarker 15 kleine Arbeiter 10 große Arbeiter 5 achteckige Errungenschaftsmarker 5 sechseckige Privilegmarker 3 Sanduhrmarker 1 Marker Legendäre Errungenschaft 1 Zeitmarker
Sanduhren: 1 grüne (2 Minuten) 1 lila (3 Minuten) 1 schwarze (45 Sekunden)
Automa (Solospiel): 32 Automa-Karten (59 x 91 mm) 3 Automa Wertungskarten (59 x 91 mm) 3 Spielhilfen (59 x 91 mm) 1 Automa-Regel 1 Automa-Wertungstableau

boardgame.name: Apotheosis
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:
In Apotheosis, 2-5 players will explore the relationship between a culture’s history and their dominant cultural story as they create and change a legend over the course of generations.

Your goal as players is to tell an interesting story about the culture you’ll develop, and to tell their dominant story in turn. You’ll be telling this story collaboratively: each player will be roleplaying as an abstraction of the culture, not as specific characters.

You’ll create and develop the basics of the culture together, seed their original dominant legend, and then watch that legend change as major historical events occur. This is a game about the relationship between what a culture experiences, and how they represent that in the stories they tell each other.

Hello!

The divine hosts have incarnated. They’re also slightly not

bad/great/good. In a series of unfortunate dates and
happenstance you will:

Conveniently be the source and solution to each other’s


problems

Complicate your Sh*t
And part ways(?)


Cheers,

Your Soul Investigator

boardgame.name: Digging Deeper
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party has been hired by a group of miners in the small, unincorporated community of Mining Town, located in the mountains west of Melanoc. Three workers have disappeared in the mines in the past month, and they believe that a snake-like beast called the Grootslang is to blame. Nothing, however, is as it seems.

Digging Deeper is a One-Sheet Scenario designed for use with Age of Ambition: Fantasy Roleplaying in an Age of Promise or Peril.

boardgame.name: Puerto Miau: Roll and Steal
boardgame.description:
Puerto Miau: Roll and Steal is a roll and write game where you will have to compete to be the cat that manages to steal as many fish from the fishmonger, become the cat that manages to steal more fish.

Roll the dice and start moving your tile around the board, you will have to choose carefully where you fall to achieve a good score since you will not be able to return to that place since you will not be the only cat moving around the board if you play accompanied, to steal. You will have to resort to your luck only then you can successfully steal each fish.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Artisan Tools and Items
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various tools and items to furnish a store, workplace or studio in rural houses, Tools for Shephards, tailors, clothiers, painters, scribes, navigators, alchemists, herbalists etc.

It also can be used as inventory tokens, for your crafty adventurers.

boardgame.name: Loot and Treasure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gold and diamonds, scrolls and potions, plenty of different loot and treasure boxes, crates, and shelves. Various colors for different metals, gems and potions.

Separate book, scroll, ingot, and potion objects for interactable objects.

boardgame.name: Rural Village Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rural village map tiles with 12 different houses, some with upper and lower floors. Perfect for a party of wandering heroes or solving mysteries within the village. Various houses, including specific specializations, weaver, herbalist, painter, storage, noble house, and of course tavern.

Furnished, unfurnished, night, day, and transparent background variations.

Also contains roofs, if you want to hide whats inside.

boardgame.name: Modern Warehouse Battlemap
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Modern warehouse battle map includes 3 separate floors (main, catwalk and basement) each being 24x27 units.

Roleplay epic modern battles, try to solve mysteries, or even roleplay basic everyday work of moving around boxes (i assume someone could do that).

Who knows what's inside the boxes in the basement, local smugglers goods, eldritch abominations, "Department 7" superweapons, or YouTuber merch.

Contains furnished, unfurnished and with lights versions of all those maps, with gridded and gridless variations. 18 images in total.

boardgame.name: Dranthek's Twilight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ruined fortress stands tall above these cliffs, overgrown by purple plants and flowers of varying shades. A rainbow stream glistens magically as it flows, reflecting the strange light and shadows of this land.

The bones of a large dragon lay forgotten below the cliffs and their crumbling bridges, shadowed by ferns which rustle gently in a faint breeze.

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked Base Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ruined fortress stands tall above these seaside cliffs, overgrown by flowers and sprawling vines. It has been turned into a base camp with hammocks and furs to sleep in within some of the towers, as well as sharpened tree branches lining the perimeter.

The bones of a large dragon lay forgotten below the ruins, shadowed by ferns which rustle gently in the breeze. It blows through the cliffs below, sometimes creating a ghostly wail. A small brook babbles past it, ignorant of the pain and suffering which once graced this land.

boardgame.name: Blossoming Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ruined fortress stands tall above these seaside cliffs. The bones of a large dragon lay forgotten below the ruins, shadowed by ferns which rustle gently in the breeze. It blows through the cliffs below, sometimes creating a ghostly wail. A small brook babbles past it, ignorant of the pain and suffering which once graced this land.

Adventure Seed

When the ship you bought passage on is wrecked in a terrible storm, your party washes ashore on an uncharted island. Around you towers the ruins of an ancient fortress, long overgrown with flowers and vines. Very little remains of its original inhabitants. The bones of a large dragon lie forgotten below the ruins, also overgrown.

Hiking up the steep pathways you find the bones of a man, covered in the tattered remnants of an oiled coat. Beneath that is a leather bound journal, covered with the same material but in much better condition.

While reading the journal you find brief notes of experiments on plants, made by a royal botanist. They detail his desperate attempts to change a yellow flowered plant into a weapon, in order to save his people from invading forces. While reading, you can hear the gentle rustling of animals in the brush around you.

You discover that many of his experiments failed, and learn how disheartened and desperate the botanist became. Eventually, however, one of his experiments succeeded. You read how it performs better than he ever dreamed, then his horror as it infects one of his assistants, then a member of the castle staff, then others.

The botanist fled when he discovered his creation could not be stopped. You learn that this isn’t the main castle at which he worked, but an outpost he was visiting on his attempt to seek passage off the island.

The last entry states “I have doomed us all, far worse than our enemy ever could. I wish everyone I knew was dead. But they’re not. They follow me, I can hear their voices, their growls as their vocal cords begin to rot and fall away in shreds. Still they pursue me. I am beginning to realize I could never escape. This is my penance for the doom I have brought upon my people.”

As you finish reading, the gentle rustling grows louder as rotting animals and humanoids covered in yellow flowers burst from the underbrush. At the tallest tower of the ruins waits their source—a huge sprawl of leafy vines and broad yellow blossoms…

What’s happening? Long ago a botanist created this plant as a weapon of war, but instead doomed all the inhabitants of the island to death. The plant is known to charm those who come near, calling them close enough so that it can drill tendrils into their brains and kill them.

It’s victims then rise, animated by the spores of the new plant that now grows within them; protecting the original plant while they can, then wondering afar to spread the spores when they finally collapse and decompose.

boardgame.name: Idol Manager
boardgame.description:
You take on the role of manager at a small (but growing!) talent agency. As you cultivate and train the newest generation of young pop stars, you'll have to decide who to hire and who to fire, who gets promoted when things go well and who gets reprimanded when things get sour. The personal lives of these young celebrities are a part of your business, and the life of a pop star isn't always a happy one. Their crowning personal achievements can be your greatest commercial successes, but their emotional meltdowns and PR nightmares can spell financial disaster for your company.

It's not just the idols you have to worry about. The world is full of gossip magazines, super fans, and rival groups, all thirsty for a scoop on the latest scandal. There's a lot of people who want to tear you down and are willing to play dirty, but try not to let it get to you. It's not personal, it's business.

Features


Decide how to deal with crises including gossip, vandalism, stalkers, or threats directed at your agency and the pop idols you manage.
Manage relationships between the different idols in your group, as you deal with cliques, internal feuds, and bullying.
Grow your fanbase by varying your tactics and appealing to a wide variety of demographics.
Produce singles, hold concerts, organize huge TV events and overseas tours to capitalize on your group's popularity and bring in revenue.
Develop your agency's building. Start with simple offices and dance rooms to produce content and train your idols, and end with your own cafe and theater to create a steady stream of revenue. Hire and train staffers to help deal with logistics and keep your agency running smoothly.
Discover substories - chains of events and visual novel segments, many of which are triggered by your play style. Each substory can play out in multiple different ways based on your decisions, often causing serious consequences for your playthrough.


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: The Throne of Skulls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an OSRIC adventure for characters of 10th level and up.

While exploring the hills far away from town the adventurers stumble upon a secret hideaway with an unusual and terrifying design. It is shaped like a giant skull. Who might live in such a place? And why is it so far away from civilization? Could it be the home of the fabled Throne of Skulls?

The Throne has long been known to be an artifact of great power and great evil. A person in possession of it is said to be nearly invincible.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Truck and Logistics Simulator
boardgame.description:
Truck & Logistics Simulator (Previously known as Transport Company Simulator and Delivery Simulator) is a simulation game where players are tasked to perform logistics from beginning to end in single or multiplayer. There is a large variety of vehicles that players can drive. Players will initially take a mission with their vehicle(semi-trucks, rigid trucks, pickups, vans), then load their vehicle using a forklift, crane, telescopic handler, loader, and other load vehicles. For vehicle carrying truck missions, players park vehicles on trailers by themselves. For dump truck missions, players will unload their vehicles by lifting the trailer up.

Multiplayer enables players to load together and make convoys. With cross-platform multiplayer support, players using Nintendo Switch, Mobile platforms, PC/Xbox and PS4 can join and do missions in the same game room.

Missions will take place in a freely accessible open world. Players will drive to logistics areas in the map and select a transport mission from available missions. Then using load vehicles (forklift, wheel loader, crane, etc.) available in the logistics area, players will load their vehicles. Following GPS, players will drive their vehicle to the destination. Driving carefully without damaging the cargo will lead to higher income.

Some missions offer more demanding challenges, like Off-Road missions where players will need to pay extra attention. Urgent missions which must be completed in the shortest time and fragile cargo missions where players must take special care when loading and delivering.

In addition, there are Day/Night cycle and realistic weather conditions including rain and fog which will affect vehicle handling.

Players can attach a trailer to their vehicle (Car/Van/Pickup) to increase their cargo capacity. Players can fill up their fuel tanks from fuel stations, and repair their vehicles in maintenance areas.

While the main focus is on the driving experience with a large variety of vehicles, Truck & Logistics Simulator also features a comprehensive economy system. Company vehicle fleets that need to be acquired, scalable warehouses that can be adjusted to the players needs, drivers that can be hired to automatically do missions and much more. (For PC version)

Truck & Logistics Simulator will be available on mobile platforms (Android, iOS, Windows Phone), Nintendo Switch and PC version will be publıshed by Aerosoft. PC version will also be available on Steam.

Features


Load your vehicle by using loading vehicles from logistical areas (Forklift, Loader, Crane etc.)
Deliver vehicles (cars, forklifts, wheel loaders, ATV's) by loading them on the trailer
Day/night cycle and Realistic Weather. Drive careful in weather conditions including Fog, Rain and Snow
GPS system: Follow GPS on the minimap or vehicle interior to reach the destination
Fuel system: Realistic fuel consumption calculation. Refuel your vehicle in gas stations
Purchase vehicles from minivans to heavy trucks and grow your logistics fleet
Build your own logistics company, hire drivers and assign vehicles
Traffic with realistic physics
Interactive interior dashboards for all vehicles (PC)
Off-Road paths: Challenging and dangerous Off-Road mission routes
Cross Platform Multiplayer with cooperative missions. Load vehicles together and make convoys.
Freely accessible 24 square kilometer map


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Booksmart
boardgame.description:
Booksmart is a game for fans of classic literature... or just the prankster in your friend group who can convince anyone of anything.

The dealer takes a card and reads out the title and author of a classic novel. Players write down what they think (or want others to think) the first sentence of that novel is.

After all answers are handed in, the dealers reads them out, slipping in the real sentence along the way. Players must vote on which answer they think is correct.

The person who guesses the correct sentence gets two points, but if you manage to trick everyone into thinking your answer is the real one, you get a point too. Player with the most points at the end wins!

Booksmart can be played with family, friends or used as an educational tool in the classroom.

The goal of The Chronicles is to present a framework for players to pursue an villainous scoundrel named Slovengris across multiple worlds or planes. Whether to pay back a personal vendetta, to collect on a myriad of bounties, to get their hands on Slovengris' supposed stash of artifacts, or to simply rid the universe of a sleaze ball (or some combination of the four), players will not lack a motive to track the scheming wizard.

Volume 1 gets the party started with a short story titled The Origins of Slovengris, a backstory that brings Slovengris to life by hitting some of the highlights (or lowlights) of his past.

The second part of Volume 1 is a 4th level adventure called The Vats of Aventhil. After yet another reckless getaway, Slovengris inadvertently finds himself on the characters' home world and wreaks havoc as he is wont to do. Local authorities enlist the aid of the player characters to stop mutant creatures harassing the countryside. Worlds collide.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Heroes I
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Héros Barathéon 1
boardgame.description:
When Robert Baratheon died, control of the Iron Throne went to his son Joffrey. However, Robert’s brothers are also seeking to claim the throne for themselves. Both Stannis and Renly want it, each one with a cadre of followers who support their claim to the Iron Throne and are willing to do what they can to seat their choice seated there.

The Baratheon Heroes #1 box set gives House Baratheon players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game a host of options for when they field an army loyal to King Stannis. The box set contains seven new characters, including a new version of King Stannis himself. With four new options for army’s Commander, players will be able to customize their forces to their liking. All the Stat and Tactics cards needed to play these devoted followers are included, so they can be used right out of the box.

boardgame.description:
Though Renly might be the younger of the Baratheon brothers looking to lay claim to the Iron Throne, it doesn’t mean he has any less conviction to go and take it. He has collected his forces and headed to the field of battle, even if it means diving House Baratheon between those loyal to him and those loyal to King Stannis.

The Baratheon Heroes #2 box set for the Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon players eager to see Lord Renly on the Iron Throne a bunch of new options for their forces. With new Attachments, NCUs, and new choices for their army Commander, the set is a great way for players to customize their forces to fit their own particular playstyle.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Gloriel Summerbloom – Star Player
boardgame.description:
Gloriel Summerbloom is famously whimsical and carefree, even for a Wood Elf! She revels in the beauty and grace of a well-played game, though she doesn't care for the violence which everyone else seems to enjoy so much. Her fans find this refreshing, whilst her detractors find it hopelessly naive. What none dispute, however, is her almost supernatural throwing accuracy and agility on the pitch.

Your Wood Elf team can hire this Star Player to ensure a stunning passing game. Not only is the model incredible, encapsulating the grace and fluidity of Wood Elfs, but her Skill list is amazing. She’s posed mid-leap, holding the ball back in a wind-up to a throw, her long braid and sash flowing around her. If you're looking for a fun painting project, the detailed leaves, vines, and hair will make for a suitably impressive display piece!

This finely detailed resin model is supplied in 9 components, including a 32mm round base. Gloriel Summerbloom is exclusively available to play for Wood Elf teams. You can find all the rules you need to use her in your games of Blood Bowl in the 7th issue of Spike! Journal, the Team Card Pack: Wood Elf Team and the Blood Bowl Almanac 2019.

Key Features
- Give the already-impressive Wood Elf passing game a boost with this unique Thrower.
- Her dynamic pose captures the beauty and grace of the Wood Elf team.
- Highly detailed leaves, vines, sashes and flowing hair make for a fun painting challenge.

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Townsfolk Tussle
boardgame.description:
After the death of the beloved sheriff of Eureka Springs, Ruffians are coming in droves to take advantage of the defenseless town! It is up to you and your fellow townsfolk to wallop these troublemakers into oblivion. And who knows—if you play your cards right, you may just prove yourself worthy of becoming the new sheriff!

Townsfolk Tussle is a co-op boss battler for 2-5 players. In each game, your goal is to take down four unique Ruffians, each one tougher than the last! You'll build up your townsfolk with gear, explore Eureka Springs, and concoct unique strategies to take down even more unique hoodlums.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Legendary Bestiary: Legendary Actions for Low-Level Monsters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Legendary actions are one of the coolest, most memorable aspects of fifth edition for me. As a DM, they allow you to make dynamic choices throughout a combat round, not just relying on a single action to make a huge impact. This element of unpredictability keeps the more tactics-minded players guessing as well, which is likely a big reason they come to the table.

boardgame.name: Legends of Runeterra: Dark Tides of Bilgewater
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Bilgewater, the most remarkable port in the world of Runeterra! D&D Beyond is thrilled to bring this renowned city to life, giving you the tools to create your own Legends of Runeterra-inspired Dungeons & Dragons campaign.

This is a world of champions and monsters, of nations rising and falling in wars of conquest and magic. The many lands of Runeterra are bursting with adventures of all kinds, from gritty street-level brawls to epic battles between supernatural powers, and Bilgewater is no exception. Packed to the gills with smugglers, scofflaws, and scoundrels, Bilgewater is more than a common pirate haven, though it has more than its fair share of pirates, too!

boardgame.name: Elemental Compendium - Creatures of the Inner Planes

The Inner Planes are the realms of raw substance, where the physical traits of all the multiverse are established and defined. The most common residents of the planes are the pureblood elementals, those creatures made of raw elemental substance given sentience. However, over countless eons, a multitude of creatures have developed from the stuff of the Inner Planes, dangerous creatures of strange power and stranger motivation.

boardgame.name: Lords and Ladies

The Feywild is as beautiful and treacherous as the beings that make it their home. It is nature untamed and imagination without restraint. In this realm of fancy and passion, where dreams grow fat and juicy on the vine and fear is as common as delight, there are those who rule. These are the Lords and Ladies of the fair folk, and their will cannot be denied.

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 536 - Jul 2020)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 536
July 2020
Ignorable Theme: What is it like in a game for a PC / NPC to discover they can do magic? Or do you always start with people who already are experienced mages?

boardgame.name: SEC Game Day
boardgame.description:
Have you ever wanted to coach a football team in the highly competitive Southeastern Conference (SEC) of college football? With SEC Game Day, you can do just that.

Pick your team- all 14 SEC teams are available- and place its respective magnet in one end zone. Next, draw your hand of cards from one of two specialized card decks (offense and defense) to simulate play calling.

One player will be on offense and the other on defense, and each player selects a play call from their hand of cards. Playing the cards simultaneously, a comparison is done using a chart on each card, with the magnetic football being moved on the board accordingly.

For example, it's 1st and 10 at the offensive player's 40 yard line. The offensive player chooses an option play, while the defensive player selects a pass defense. The chart on the card indicates that the play results in a 10-yard gain. The football is moved forward to the 50 yard line and both players get ready to pick their next play.

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Bitter Harvest
boardgame.description:
On June 28th, 1942 the German High Command launched its summer offensive (Case Blue) against the southern lines of the Soviet Union. 2 Army Groups of 10 Armies-nearly 35 Divisions and 2 full Air Corps, were unleashed against the Soviet lines. It involved a two-pronged attack. One along the Axis right flank driving to the Caucasus and the vital oil fields of Baku, and the other against the left flank in the direction of Stalingrad and the Volga River. The battle would rage for 2 months over several hundred square kilometers that would take the German Army to the gates of Stalingrad itself.

Heroes Road to Stalingrad is a new East Front module for the Lock 'n Load Tactical series. It features a fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics, plus lots of armor and special rules to bring the fight for the southern steppes of Russia to life. German Landser, Mechanized, and Armored formations clash with Soviet Line, Guards, and NKVD Divisions. New units never before seen in the Lock 'n Load Tactical series are introduced. The German Pz IV F and G along with the Marder II and StuG IIIF join the battlefield as well as the Soviet Tachanka MG wagon, NKVD troops, and the IL2 Sturmovik. We also introduce a new leader type-the Incompetent Leader. The scenarios range from the city of Voronezh and through Rostov, as far south as the Caucasus Mountains. Into the footsteps of the Silk Road at Khulkhuta, up and into the outskirts of Stalingrad itself.


The steppes of southern Russia await you!

As you walk through the historical center you sip various drinks and try not to pass out. Both bar visits and random surprises on the game plan affect your point score.

Game plan contains various events, public tramway system, theme of the game round, bar attributes and finally - your game character which gives you a unique possibilities. As in real life your are motivated to explore and experience the whole setting of the game.
Who has the most point from drinks and food consummation after all the game rounds passes by - wins!

New ancients, new ancient abilities, new encounters, new races, new classes, and new rewards add a wealth of variety to your game and versatility to your hero builds—simply shuffle the extra cards into your game and you are ready to go.

New Tales includes all of the extra cards we weren't able to squeeze into the Kickstarter: awesome new races, classes, sagas, encounters, and rewards to beef up and enrich your experience of Shadows of Kilforth!

Did I even mention that New Tales also comes with eight gorgeous standees?? We've had to make the box even bigger than the pictured box just to fit them all in!

Two of these dice are also available as a part of the Stanza character Add-on in Game to Pick a Game.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Rancid King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to five characters of levels 7-9

This module’s lead-in best works in craggy terrain during a random encounter. After a few rounds, the ground begins to rumble and shift as a sinkhole opens, sending boulders and combatants tumbling thirty feet down into a cavernous chamber.

This is the lost tomb of Daruig Danan who was known by the moniker, “The Rancid King.” He was a reviled warlord who subjugated local provinces under tyrannical rule. After dying suddenly, his twin sons Gildan and Rhodig fought for throne and supremacy, plunging the region into civil war. The twins perished in combat; their bodies enshrined in the Rancid King’s tomb.

boardgame.name: Alternate Travel Rules
Travelcraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Journey Should Matter

5e, and really any edition of the game, has a problem with how boring and inconsequential the travel component of the game is by its very design. Take a walk, take a long rest. The alternative is the hexcrawl which is an interesting gamestyle that might also benefit from some simple changes that make the actual act of traveling something the characters must contend with.

Travelcraft is a new 5e product that seeks to capture the feel of traveling with purpose and challenge. By utilizing a new, simple system that easily allows DMs of any skill level to challenge players in more ways than just "Reduce the enemy's HP to zero," Travelcraft makes a great edition to the library of all groups.

With a rework to how rests work outside of civilization, the creation of an easy to utilize DC setting system for various biomes and weather, and support for underutilized Skills and Tool Proficiencies, Travelcraft is a non-intrusive ruleset that will make your outdoor adventures truly memorable.

boardgame.name: Raiders of Scythia: Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
Cement your victory with these hefty metal coins! This set of 32 detailed metal coins will replace the cardboard tokens included in the game.

—description from the publisher

Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. There is space for all cards to be sleeved.

boardgame.name: Carteros
boardgame.description:
As a good postman, study the streets well to manage to deliver all your letters first. It doesn't seem difficult, but be careful with the dogs!

in your turn you have 3 action points, with them you can move arround the neighborhood, deliver mail, draw a card, use a card, or discard / replace an card.

Whoever achieves the highest number of victory points between the value of the cards delivered and the tips received is the winner.


Español
-Como buen cartero, estudia bien las calles para lograr entregar primero todas tus cartas. No parece dificil, pero !ten cuidado con los perros!.

Utiliza puntos de acción para moverte, entregar correspondencia, Robar una carta, utilizar una carta o descartar/reemplazar una carta.

Quien logre mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria entre valor de cartas entregadas y propinas recibidas es el ganador.

boardgame.name: Goal!
boardgame.description:
Goal! is a Dutch football game that is played by two players. Each player has a goalkeeper and ten field players. The game board consists of square boxes.
In one turn, a player rolls two dice: a die with special actions such as passing or dribbling and a regular die to determine how many squares the actions can be performed. The ball can be placed on a player's foot so that possession is clear.
The goal is simple: score more goals than your opponent within the agreed time.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Hard City: Heroes of Hard City
boardgame.description:
This expansion will allow you to play as five new heroes: William Casey, Aaron Kaufmann, Regan O’Hara, Garett Oliver and the H.A.R.DMan!

Set includes:
5x officers miniatures,
30x skill cards,
5x officer sheets.

boardgame.name: Score
boardgame.description:
Score is a Dutch football game played by two players.
Each player has 11 cards: 8 with the value 1, 2 with the value 2 and 1 with the value 3. Each player makes his line-up by placing the cards on the squares on the board.
Each turn the players may take turns to perform an action: two players change positions (keeping the player in possession of the ball) or play the ball to another player. All actions are done via the black lines on the game board. If the player is in one of tehe 5 forward positions with the ball and he has a higher value than his direct opponent, he will score a goal. If there is no goal scored within five actions, the possession will change to the other player.
The winner is the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary

boardgame.name: BX Options: Class Builder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take the guesswork out of creating new classes for B/X-style RPGs

The BX Options: Class Builder is the only race-as-class creation system 100% compatible with the classic fantasy classes presented in the core rules. Infinitely scalable for any setting or genre, the BX Options: Class Builder lets you create new (or modify existing) classes guaranteed to match the level progression rates of the canon.

Contained herein is everything you need to create perfectly balanced classes for B/X-style RPGs, including:

Class building system
30 variants of the existing classes
13 new sub-classes
Optional d6 skill system
A d6 conversion of the classic Thief skills
Optional spell failure guidelines
Animal totems and abilities
New armour and weapons
High-level options for advancing classes beyond 14th level

boardgame.name: Conan the Cimmerian: The Tower of the Elephant
boardgame.description:
In a Maul tavern, Conan hears the tale of an enormous jewel called “The Elephant’s Heart” and of Yara, the terrible sorcerer who possesses it, drawing power from it to fuel his strange magics. Near Maul stands the impossible tower that houses Yara, his jewel, and his soldiers. A tower that no one dares enter, with walls polished to infinity, so no one can climb them. Thus, there is no way to acquire the jewel. But for Conan, when desire is coupled with courage, there is ALWAYS a way.

Conan the Cimmerian: The Tower of the Elephant is a towering tabletop combat adventure in which you fight to steal The Elephant’s Heart. There are two ways to play. In Solo Mode, a single player becomes Conan, battling the game itself. In Battle Mode, one player becomes Conan, and the other player becomes the twisted wizard Yara, casting spells, deploying soldiers and eldritch horrors to punish Conan for his temerity.

Conan's adventure in Tower of the Elephant moves him from the town of Maul to a moonlit garden. From there, he will climb to the top of an impossible tower and face terrors he never imagined!

Conan's adventure through the Tower of the Elephant involves overcoming the challenges of many unique locations, each represented by a Tenfold Dungeon Box. Each location is explored in a single turn which consists of a Dice, Location, Combat, and Mopping Up phase. There are 10 locations in Tower of the Elephant which Conan must overcome to emerge victorious!

Players are not required to complete every location in a single sitting, and may stop playing between locations in order to resume play in another play session. Conan retains his level, skill, and items between each session so that he is always prepared for his next adventure!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Artifacts of the Tarot
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
In the depths of an ancient burial chamber, a mysterious artifact catches the eye of an intrepid adventurer. Her curiosity draws her in, and the inscriptions on your frame draw her close. As you entice her with images of power and wealth you wonder if she can accomplish what those who came before her could not. She collects you from the altar and resumes her expedition. With each new host comes a new opportunity. Your journey begins anew.

Artifacts of the Tarot is a game about smart swords, cursed cups, pernicious pentacles, and other artifacts with agency. You are Will made manifest, an Item of incredible power, and you will pursue your goals by any means at your disposal. You will need to be acquired, transported, and coveted by a Hero you will inspire to accomplish your goals.

boardgame.name: As the World Ends...
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As The World Ends... probably won’t end happy. It isn’t meant to. It’s a chance to explore things we normally don’t allow ourselves to. Things we hide. Things we cling to. Moments we live for. Sadness. Regret. Hope. This is about hoping against hope. By the end, you may have nothing physical left. But you might have some feelings that you finally dug into and examined. Hopefully, that gets you something or somewhere you may not have otherwise.

A GM isn’t necessary for this game but having one may make play easier to guide and help keep things on track. Alternately, if one person feels comfortable enough in the roll, they can play a character as well as guide the story.

The world is ending around you and you’re trying to make your way to some place you consider safe. You’re not sure if it is safe but you’ve heard rumors.

boardgame.name: Elements of the Gods
boardgame.description:
You are a young god at the dawn of civilization, using the powers of the elements to gather worshipers and influence them to do your bidding. Use stonemasons to build monuments to glorify your name, and beautify your monuments with lush green spaces tended by gardeners. You’ll also need mystics to perform your sacred rituals, and the zealots willing to spill their own blood in your honor. The god who can attain the most glory wins!

On your turn, you will choose one of the five Elements and place it on the board, manipulating the Worshipers to allow you to play a card from your hand. You will score points by building Monuments and Gardens and playing Divinity cards, and at the end of the game you will score bonus points from the Worshipers in your domain.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Here is Some F***ing D&D
Here is Some Fucking D&D
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Here is Some Fucking D&D is another concise retro-clone, incorporating basic play of early editions with some dressing of later editions.

The major focus appears to be to pack as much profanity as possible into the eight pages of rules.

boardgame.name: At the Monarch's Gate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
You and your companions have traveled across long distances
and faced many trials to come to this point, in the hope that you
will be heard by the one person who can grant you what you need.
Now you stand at the gate to the Monarch’s throne room, seeking
entrance and an audience.

All that stands in your way is the Gate Guard, who extends their
hand and demands that you leave your weapons at the door.

At the Monarch’s Gate is a single-session, GM-lite storytelling game that can be
played in the space of two to three hours. You will tell the histories of the
weapons you carry as you surrender them, one by one, before entering the
presence of a powerful ruler. Use a combination of dice and Tarot cards to build
your reputation while revealing your true intentions—or keeping them hidden.

boardgame.name: That's So Gay!
boardgame.description:
The phrase “That’s so gay!” has been used mostly in a negative context for decades. Some people use it as a way to attack or vilify us, and others use it in fun, not realizing the damage it can do. As with the reclaiming of negative words and phrases such as “queer,” this game seeks to turn “That’s so gay!” into a positive opportunity to educate LGBTQs and our allies, and even those people who would attack us. Words can be a tool of our enemies, or can empower us in our work. And this game hopes to break down stereotypes while having some fun with our LGBTQ history. There are the well-known celebrities and media sensations, but also obscure authors, scientists, athletes and pioneers. The scope of the game goes back thousands of years and across multiple continents, all with more than 2,400 questions that will tease you, taunt you, and treat you to some amazing facts. This game would be the most enjoyable for adults and for children ages 12 and up. It is best played in teams, but even two players can have fun testing their knowledge. There are all ranges of questions, so even those who think they “know it all” about the LGBTQ community will undoubtedly sometimes find themselves stumped. This game was created and produced by Tracy Baim, co-founder and publisher of Windy City Times, an LGBTQ newspaper founded in 1985. She has been volunteering and working in the LGBTQ community since 1984.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Shadow Over the Greatwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trouble is brewing in the Rosewood Highlands. Wild Animals, usually timid and shy around the encroaching wave of human civilization, have become very hostile, attacking with no provocation whatsoever. More concerning is the fact that predators and prey are running in packs together. To top it all off, Old Joby swears he was some kind of beast-man up north of Gabon's Ridge... and then he says a cougar was talking to the other day and then it exploded! (Of course, Old Joby is drunk a lot...)

A Shadow Over the Greatwood is a sandbox adventure for characters levels 5-7 and was written for Swords & Wizards in the Highlands, a Swords & Wizards Rules Variant.

17 specific adventure locations

20+ NPCs, potential allies and foes

70+ New Magic Items

boardgame.name: Vector! Attack of the Metapirates
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

!!WARNING!!

What you hold in your hands is not an adventure, supplement,
setting, or campaign, but a MEMETIC VIRUS

Upon introducing this into your game, it may never be the same. Vector and the Meta Pirates may spread their influence into not only one game, but many, and should they not be contained or halted, may even irrevocably alter you and your players.

You have been warned.

Vector: Attack of the Meta Pirates is a multi part supplement for use in any tabletop roleplaying game. Rules contained within should be useable in most systems with little alteration, but may take some adjustment depending on setting or rule set.

In Phase 1, a one shot adventure introduces the Meta Pirates, their captain Vector, and Meta Dimensional treasures.

In Phase 2, Vector has taken up a semi-permanent residence within the campaign world, establishing a dimensional port and following players from game to game.

In Phase 3, Vector becomes actively involved in the campaign world behind the scenes. Can the players unravel the mystery before ‘bad’ Vector ruins the setting?

In Phase 4, the Meta Dimension takes center stage. Vector will lead your players on a wild ride through myriad worlds in an epic quest to save reality itself.

User summary:

This BETA version was distributed to Kickstarter backers during the campaign. The Kickstarted did not fund, leaving this BETA as the final-state of the effort.

See also The Gift That Keeps On Giving! A Vector! Attack of the Metapirates Holiday Adventure

boardgame.description:
Roll and run game. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 120 wins the game. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the player. The players may gain and loose tokens while playing. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game is the starting player for the next game.

This promotional game is from the 1950s.

boardgame.name: Shepherd's Crossing - Player Guide
boardgame.description:
A Role-Playing Game for All-Ages

From the introduction:

You are about to begin your first day at the Shepherd's Crossing School of Magic when things go awry. It's up to you and your team to solve the mystery and save the school!

User summary:

15-page rules
1-page blank character sheet

boardgame.name: The Shadowy Beings
boardgame.description:
A Role-Playing Game for All-Ages

From the introduction:

You are on your way to your new boarding school in Toronto, Canada. The entrance to the School is located on a busy residential street just next to a gigantic public park called High Park. There is so much foot traffic heading to and from the park that it’s easy to overlook the abundance of visitors to 14 Shepherd’s Trail. Like most of the houses in the neighbourhood, it is an old red brick house. Unlike most of the houses, when you walk through the door, you enter into the magical Village of Shepherd’s Crossing.

User summary:

21-page adventure
four 1-page pre-generated characters (Marjorie, Pumpkin, Tesseract, and Zeke)

boardgame.name: Shepherd's Crossing School of Magic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Shepherd’s Crossing School of Magic. Every year, students of all ages attend our School to learn a variety of subjects, both magical and otherwise. This Guide contains information that will help you on your first days here.

boardgame.name: Guide to the Village of Shepherd's Crossing
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Shepherd’s Crossing is home to the world renowned Shepherd’s Crossing School of Magic. Every year, students of all ages attend the School to learn a variety of subjects, both magical and otherwise.

boardgame.name: Space Plague
boardgame.description:
Space Plague is a modern strategy game of planetary conquest for 1-4 players. The four major galactic powers -The Slimes, The Reptilians, The Rams, and The Flat-Earthers - all want one thing, galactic dominance. Their commanders ready themselves, the armies follow orders, and everything that can shake, shakes. The race to conquer new planets is the most important game in the galaxy and those that win it will gain for themselves and their species a brand new spherical land mass to rule and to populate.

In Space Plague, players will employ hand management and hand building strategies to efficiently guide their plague soldiers through various ecological environments while collecting energy (the game’s currency), adapting to planetary events, and overcoming the opponents’ obstacles that await them on their unwavering march toward the planet’s core. Survival of the fittest is the name of the game as the faction with the greatest number of soldiers to reach the core will be crowned the victor and given the deed to the planet.

The keys to victory are careful planning and adaptability. Everyone will begin the game with the same starting hand of action cards. These will be used each round to spawn, move, shield, or evolve your aliens. Additionally, certain factors will give variability to each game. Each planet you conquer has its own defense mechanisms which will force you to employ unique strategies and play styles. Planetary events are randomized and could spell riches or doom for your advancing soldiers. Additionally, the in-game marketplace offers dozens of evolutions that will improve the capabilities of your hand or grant you unique ongoing or temporary powers ensuring a different game every time. These elements not only force interesting decisions but also give the game extensive replayability.

Fellow commander, are you ready to join the plague?

—description from the designer

Space Plague es un moderno juego de estrategia de conquista planetaria de 1-4 jugadores. Los cuatro poderes galácticos principales, los Resbaladizos, los Reptoides, las cabras y los Terraplanistas, todos quieren una cosa, el dominio galáctico. Sus comandantes se preparan, los ejércitos siguen órdenes y todo lo que puede temblar, tiembla. La carrera para conquistar nuevos planetas es el juego más importante de la galaxia y aquellos que lo ganen obtendrán para ellos y su especie una nueva masa de tierra esférica para gobernar y poblar.

En Space Plague, los jugadores emplearán estrategias de manejo y construcción de manos para guiar de manera eficiente a sus creaturas de la plaga a través de varios entornos ambientales mientras recolectan energía (la moneda del juego), se adaptan a los eventos planetarios y superan los obstáculos de los oponentes que los esperan en su marcha hacia el núcleo del planeta. La supervivencia del más apto es el nombre del juego, ya que la facción con el mayor número de creaturas para llegar al núcleo será coronado como vencedor y se le otorgará el dominio planetario.

Las claves de la victoria son la planificación cuidadosa y la adaptabilidad. Todos comenzarán el juego con la misma mano inicial de cartas de acción. Estos se usarán en cada ronda para generar, mover, proteger o evolucionar a tus criaturas alienígenas. Además, ciertos factores darán variabilidad a cada juego. Cada planeta que conquiste tiene sus propios mecanismos de defensa que te obligarán a emplear estrategias y estilos de juego únicos. Los eventos planetarios son aleatorios y podrían significar riquezas o perdición para los soldados que avanzan. Además, el mercado del juego ofrece decenas de evoluciones que mejorarán las capacidades de tu mano o te otorgarán poderes únicos continuos o temporales que garantizan un juego diferente cada vez. Estos elementos no solo obligan a tomar decisiones interesantes, sino que también le dan al juego una amplia rejugabilidad.

Pequeño comandante, ¿está listo para unirse a la plaga?

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 4th Edition Conversion Tables
Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Tabele Konwersji na 4 Edycję
WFRP 4a Edizione: Guida alla Conversione
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Conversion Tables provide a guide for converting first and second edition Characters and NPCs to the current fourth edition rules. We’ve included a comprehensive list of Skills and Talents, with some additional guidance on updating trickier Character Traits.

This document is a useful addition for any Grognard who wants to dust off a beloved Character and take them through a new adventure in the Old World, or for newer players who wish to delve into some of the earlier edition PDFs Cubicle 7 has made available.

Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Conversion Tables includes:

A handy chart for converting Characteristics from first and second edition to WFRP’s fourth edition.
A list of Skills from second edition and their closest match in WFRP fourth edition.
A list of Talents from the first and second edition and their closest match in WFRP’s fourth edition.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Tabele Konwersji na 4 Edycję
WFRP 4a Edizione: Guida alla Conversione - Italian PDF Edition

boardgame.name: Grimdark Future: Starter Set – Battle for Magellan-2
boardgame.description:
Grimdark Future is a miniature wargame set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi battles for new and experienced players alike.

This starter set gives you everything you need to start playing exciting battles right away, without having to worry about painting miniatures or putting together your own army lists. With game rules that fit on a single page, you'll be able to learn them quickly and start playing in no time!

Simply print out all pages and assemble the armies as described, and you’ll have two balanced forces ready to clash on the field of battle.

Additionally are also provided a set of terrain pieces to spice up your games, as well as a set of play tokens to help you track different game effects.

The Battle for Magellan-2 Starter Set contains all of the following contents:

Core Game Rules
Unit Stat Cards (12 Cards)
Battle Brothers Army (16 Miniatures)
Heroes: Captain
Troops: Assault Brothers, Tactical Brothers
Upgrades: Flamethrower, Missile Launcher

Orc Marauders Army (27 Miniatures)
Heroes: Warlord, Shaman
Troops: Orc Mobs, Boss Mobs
Upgrades: Heavy Machinegun, Rocket Launcher

Terrain Pack (11 Terrain Pieces)
Small: Fields, Crates & Barrels, Barricades
Large: Forests, Ruins

Play Tokens (106 Tokens)
Objectives, Activations, Wounds, Pinning
Magic, Suppression, Fatigue, Danger



—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Any Planet Is Earth
boardgame.description: Any Planet Is Earth is a set of sandbox guidelines for creating a near/far future adventure campaign. With an emphasis on realism, lateral thinking, and simple rules, players will seek jobs, bounties, trade, and rumors, accept death, and try to leave their mark on the starscape which naturally emerges from details, dilemmas, and decisions. The game takes its inspiration from Marc Miller's Traveller (Classic), Chris McDowall's Into The Odd, and Ambrosia Software's Escape Velocity series.

boardgame.name: The Yorling of Mansk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghelspad Expanded!

Ghelspad is a massive and diverse land. Once a paradise, this continent is now scarred by the ravages of the Titanswar. In the wake of divine bloodshed, and beset on all sides by titanspawn, the people of Ghelspad survive and thrive on this befouled continent. Vigil Watch explores six different locations across Ghelspad.

From the bloody shores of the Toe Islands in the east to the Sweltering Plains of the west, Vigil Watch provides an in-depth look at a variety of locales and cultures.

boardgame.name: Leoni
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghelspad Expanded!

Ghelspad is a massive and diverse land. Once a paradise, this continent is now scarred by the ravages of the Titanswar. In the wake of divine bloodshed, and beset on all sides by titanspawn, the people of Ghelspad survive and thrive on this befouled continent. Vigil Watch explores six different locations across Ghelspad.

From the bloody shores of the Toe Islands in the east to the Sweltering Plains of the west, Vigil Watch provides an in-depth look at a variety of locales and cultures.

boardgame.name: A Wretched Menagerie of Ungulates
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goats, sheep, horses, rhinoceroses, elk, centaurs, triceratops, hippocamps . . . herd animals and ungulates of all stripes to fill out your OSR bestiary. Is Animal, Herd really sufficient for your trek across the savannah?

Contains 86 specific animals, a table for quickly estimating ungulate statistics based on animal weight, and a small selection of rules and conversion notes for using the book.

About a Wretched Menagerie: Written in a compact (some would say cramped) style with minimal fuss and no art, each manuscript in this series covers a narrow niche of creatures. Tools for estimating statistics based on size and ferocity, rationalized statistics for a wide variety of real world (and fantastical) creatures within the niche, and a small selection of extra rules will be standard for each.

boardgame.name: A Wretched Menagerie of Furry Pests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beavers, wombats, wolverines, rat kings, 100-foot-long rabbits, capybara . . . pests and pelts of all stripes to fill out your OSR bestiary. Is Rat, Giant really sufficient for your delve into the sewers?

Contains 73 specific animals, a table for quickly estimating furry pest statistics based on animal weight, and a small selection of rules and conversion notes for using the book.

About a Wretched Menagerie: Written in a compact (some would say cramped) style with minimal fuss and no art, each manuscript in this series covers a narrow niche of creatures. Tools for estimating statistics based on size and ferocity, rationalized statistics for a wide variety of real world (and fantastical) creatures within the niche, and a small selection of extra rules will be standard for each.

boardgame.name: A Wretched Menagerie of Avians & Reptiles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Giant tortoises, atrociraptors, bats, boat swans, cockatrices, emus, snakes, vultures . . . sauropsida (and sauropsida-like creatures) of all kinds to fill out your OSR bestiary. Is Toad, Giant really sufficient for your squat amphibian needs?

Contains 88 specific animals, a table for quickly estimating avian, lizard, snake, turtle, and toad statistics based on animal weight, and a small selection of rules and conversion notes for using the book.

About a Wretched Menagerie: Written in a compact (some would say cramped) style with minimal fuss and no art, each manuscript in this series covers a narrow niche of creatures. Tools for estimating statistics based on size and ferocity, rationalized statistics for a wide variety of real world (and fantastical) creatures within the niche, and a small selection of extra rules will be standard for each.

boardgame.name: A Wretched Catalogue of Gear
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four-cubit pole, 1/2" rope, braziers, concealed vest pockets for a thief, bucket, hourglass, small hatchet . . . bits and bobs of gear useful to dungeoneers (and short wilderness jaunts) of all sorts, and more than you can reasonably carry.

Contains over 100 general types of gear, and lots of sub-types, arranged for ease of discovery and use. Note that most core rule books for OSR games have some portion of this list already (although there are extremely useful items like charcoal, flour, wheelbarrows, stools, umbrellas, and similar that have been foolishly ignored elsewhere). This manuscript is more useful for its brief descriptions and "all in one place" quality than gonzo equipment.

boardgame.name: Ars Bellum
boardgame.description:
Relive the great battles of Antiquity and at the head of your army, impose your power on your opponent!

ARS BELLUM is a game of medium complexity, allowing you to simulate all the battles of antiquity. The mechanics are concentrated on 5 pages of rules, for a 16-page booklet with illustrations and scenarios. The whole is easily learned. This system can be a game of discovery of wargames, but also a system that will satisfy the most seasoned players.

This game seeks to have the best compromise between historicity (orders of battle, aspect of the units) and playability.

Players play out the battles of the proposed scenarios, which are descirbed on A4 or A3 maps. Their style is simple and clean. The duration of a game is 1 to 2 hours.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men depending on the type of unit and the scenario. For some scenarios, these figures are theoretical given the sources (difficult to represent the million men of Darius or Xerxes or others).

The system is based on the initiative won by players as a result of a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario.

In ARS BELLUM, the system is based on the skills of the units, which balance reality and gameplay. These are abilities assigned to units, basic or special, that represent a property or advantage during combat.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and discovery scenarios; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more armies, a historical character, a military campaign.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Revivez les grandes batailles de l'Antiquité et à la tête de votre armée, imposez votre puissance à votre adversaire !

ARS BELLUM est un jeu de complexité moyenne, permettant de simuler toutes les batailles de l’Antiquité. Les mécanismes sont concentrés sur 5 pages de règles, pour un livret comportant 16 pages avec les illustrations et les scénarios. L’ensemble est aisément assimilable. Ce système peut être un jeu de découverte des wargames, mais aussi un système qui satisfera les joueurs les plus aguerris.

Ce jeu cherche à avoir le meilleur compromis entre historicité (ordres de bataille, aspect des unités) et jouabilité.

Les joueurs livrent les batailles des scénarios proposés sur des cartes A4 ou A3 maximum. Leur style est simple, propre. La durée d’une partie est d’1 à 2h.

Les unités (chefs ou de combat) ont une capacité de mouvement et de combat (regroupant éventuellement celle de tir) et représentent 500 à 1000 ou 2000 hommes suivant le type d’unités et le scénario. Pour certains scénarios, ces chiffres sont théoriques compte tenu des sources (difficiles de représenter le million d’hommes de Darius ou Xerxès ou autres).

Le système est basé sur l’initiative conquise par les joueurs suite à un jet de dé et à l’impact des chefs et/ou autre modificateur dans le scénario.

Dans ARS BELLUM, le système s’appuie sur les compétences des unités qui amènent respect de la réalité et particularité ludique. Ce sont des capacités attribuées aux unités, de base ou particulières et qui représentent une propriété ou un avantage durant le combat.

Le module de base du jeu donne l’essentiel des règles et les scénarios de découverte ; les extensions sont des regroupements de scénarios autour d’une ou plusieurs armées, d’un personnage historique, d’une campagne militaire.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Qua
boardgame.description:
Qua is a three-dimensional (3D) abstract strategy game for three players. It is an extension of the two-dimensional, two player game called Gale, marketed as Bridg-It. Qua is played on a 3D game board grid composed of NxNxN cells in the shape of a cube, where N is typically odd and equal to the number of cells along each edge of the game board.

The objective of Qua is to be the first player to complete a connected chain (path) of cells containing their game play pieces between their two opposite faces of the game board cube.

The 3D game board does not start out empty. Some of the cells in the game board are permanently filled-in with one of three game play pieces, called qua. See Figure 1 from the Images gallery above: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/5539928/qua. The three qua game play pieces--one for each player--are distinguished from each other by shape and color.

Rules
Players choose their qua at the beginning of the game and decide who will go first, second and third in sequential turn order. Each turn, players place one of their qua in an empty cell in the game board cube.

Players may only place qua in an empty cell if it is adjacent to two cells that already contain their qua, or one such cell and one of their two game board cube faces.

If a player cannot make a move, they skip their turn.

If the current player is in a Kingmaker situation where one of the other players will win on their next turn and the one who wins will be determined by the current player's move, then the Qua Kingmaker game play rule states that the current player blocks the immediate next player's win first. However, if no one identifies the Kingmaker situation, and the current player makes a different move, then that move is valid.

The game ends when the first player connects their two faces of the Qua Cube game board.

Game Play Variants
Qua Misere
The first player that connects their two faces of the game board loses. This can be a two-player game.

Dice Qua
Players roll a 6-sided die to determine which game play piece to play on their turn (two sides of the die for each game play piece). This can also be played as a two-person game. A player may win as a result of an opponent’s move.

boardgame.name: Unlikely Heroes: Vikings
boardgame.description:
A puzzling narrative adventure game. In the Vikings box, the unlikely heroes must venture out on the three quests: The Ruins, the Mead & the Undead.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map.

As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Box contents
50+ page Adventure book
200+ Gamecards
20 x Acrylic cubes
4 x Meeples
Rulebook

Game box information
1-4 players. 60-90 minutes per quest. Ages 14+.

boardgame.name: Dis Pontibus
boardgame.description:
Guide a young robot explorer on its mission of discovery and enlightenment! Collect the wisdom of a long-lost archipelagic civilization!

Dis Pontibus is a minimalist yet deep puzzle game, with procedurally generated and auto-curated levels.

Its mechanics are very simple, but its gameplay can be very challenging.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Quin
boardgame.description:
Quin is an abstract tabletop strategy game, taking place in a sci-fi quantum realm. Players control a variety of quark particles, 17 on each side, made of 9 types, each with distinct speed, powers and capture abilities. The goal of Quin is to reach First Sight, Center, with your Light, or to capture your opponent's Light.

Your pieces are always faced away from your rival, making deception and memory two of the most important skills in play. Use a piece's special abilities - like Memory that swaps places with another piece, Time that can move an opposing piece backward, Peripherals that can circle the sides of the board, or Shadows that reach far and capture everything - and you risk revealing your strategy. In Quin, your choices, and how well you know your rival, are what determine your fate.

The magnetic Quin board is based on a traditional grid, if you can imagine that grid warped into a circle by a black hole. As such it is made of 5 Sight Lines, crossing the board at the center, 8 gold Rings, a Horizon Line, and the Iris. The Iris is just 2 spaces around the center, where most pieces have to pass if they want to get to the other side, and it is a neutral zone, where powers don't work. In the middle of it all is First Sight, Center, and the goal of the game.

It's only 5 moves to center, from the start, but you'll never take the same route twice. Awaken your Memory, look out for the thief of Time, and beware the Shadows - they're far faster than Light.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Path of the Drowned Barbarian
boardgame.description:
"A primal path for players (and DMs) who want to build a seafaring babarian with powers gifted from beyond the grave.

Barbarians who walk this path excel in aquatic combat and have recieved blessings (or curses) from souls who lost their lives at sea. This has granted them an undead resilience and fortitude while also granting them ghostly abilities that other sailors would view as unnatural and bad luck.

This primal path gives you everything you will need to play a barbarian in a seafaring setting as well as allowing you to summon spectral chains, create grog and gain a pet psychopomp."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Grit & Vigor
boardgame.description:
From drivethrurpg:

Your pulse pounds

Beads of sweat run down your brow

You grip your pistol tighter

It can all be yours

It just takes GRIT & VIGOR

GRIT & VIGOR is the game of bold ventures for rugged fellows. Roll up a character, buy some gear, and get down to business. G&V is rules lite and options heavy. In its 200 pages, you'll find everything from monsters to machine guns, with advice on running all sorts of modern campaigns, from gentlemanly mysteries to espionage to explorations into the unknown. It also includes a timeline of adventure, covering the years 1880 to 1939, with important events of those years as well a selection of the firearms, cars, planes and military vehicles of those years. Future supplements will expand that coverage back to the Golden Age of Piracy and forward into the far future.

GRIT & VIGOR is compatible with most old school games, including BLOOD & TREASURE.

boardgame.name: Solar Storm: Neoprene Mat
boardgame.description:
A high quality 14x28 inch neoprene playmat to really make your Solar Storm experience immersive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chakra: Yin Yang
boardgame.description:
The 4 distinct modules of Yin-Yang can be combined at will for a brand-new gameplay experience of Chakra.

The first module introduces new strategic opportunities with the white crystals. They allow you to increase the speed and flow of energies by temporarily harmonizing Chakras. By combining them with negative energies, you will gain Yin-Yang tokens, an additional source of plenitude.

The second module and its harmonization bonuses will speed up the game and make every Chakra attractive, while the third module will have you race to achieve your objectives, forcing you to make difficult choices and increasing interaction.

The last module will then require good timing to benefit the most from the available special abilities.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Alien Puppies

Alien Puppies is a Strategic Sci-Fi Card Game Adventure with Fabulous Cyberpunk Puppies.

Players take turns drawing from the shuffled deck and collect Alien Puppies & other cards. Each turn, you can choose to put 1 Alien Puppy to your backyard (the space in front of you). The first person to put 3 Alien Puppies in the Backyard wins!

But! You will have to be careful as there's a dangerous Barkmageddon card looming in the draw pile. If you draw it, you lose unless you can protect yourself with unique combos.

Alien Puppies adventure features unique set of characters and mind-bending powers that will be have to be activated by players to become the ultimate champions of the puppy universe.

-description from publisher
